newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil court rejects re-election injunction plea.
newsitem.headline: Brazil court rejects re-election injunction plea.

text.p: Brazil's highest court, the Supreme Federal Tribunal (STF), has ruled that the government may continue in its attempts to seek Congressional approval of its re-election initiative during January, an STF spokeswoman said.

STF president Sepulveda Pertence rejected the arguments of the Brazilian Progressive Party, which sought an injunction suspending any votes on re-election during a special, month-long session of the Congress, the spokeswoman said.
The injunction request was the latest attempt by the party to short-circuit the government's efforts to get re-election sanctioned by Congress.
The PPB includes Paulo Maluf, the former mayor of Sao Paulo whose own presidential ambitions depend largely on sidelining President Fernando Henrique Cardoso from the 1998 elections.
